With the required Hunter level and partial completion of the Eagles' Peak quest, the player may set up a box trap. When a chinchompa or ferret passes the trap, it may be caught, but only when the player is not standing on the trap.

A box trap is a type of trap used in the Hunter skill. The box trapping technique is used to catch ferrets and chinchompas. With the required Hunter level and partial completion of the Eagles' Peak quest, the player may set up a box trap. When a chinchompa or ferret passes the trap, it may be caught, but only when the player is not standing on the trap.

If the prey is successfully caught, the box trap will close in around the animal, and the player will have the option to "check" the trap. If not successful, the trap will also close, and the player will have to reset it.

Adding bait to a trap will increase the catch rate by +3%, while smoking a trap will increase the catch rate by +2%.[1] Due to the low increase of the catch rate, most players believe that smoking or adding bait to traps doesn't justify the extra actions it takes.

Box traps may be bought from Aleck's Hunter Emporium. in Yanille or the Nardah Hunter Shop in Nardah. One can also be obtained for free by searching the crate adjacent to the bookcases in the northernmost house at Land's End. They can also be obtained from hunter kit.

Like other laid traps, box traps cannot be placed:

  • while in duels at the Duel Arena
  • at the Blast Furnace
  • Taverley, Dwarven Mine and Mining Guild
  • Wintertodt (including the waiting area) and Ungael's crater
  • Tempoross Cove
  • Hallowed Sepulchre and The Nightmare fight
  • on fairy rings
  • inside most indoor areas
  • Farming Guild
  • Basement of Doom - while spectating your cat through a curtain
  • Lizardman Temple
  • player-owned houses
  • inside banks and next to various bank chests
    • (but next to the bank chest at Trouble Brewing, the Ver Sinhaza bank booths and the Rogues' Den bank chest is possible)
  • Hespori's cave
  • Zulrah's shrine
  • Catacombs of Kourend
  • in underwater areas
  • Theatre of Blood
  • near Shura and Sisterhood Sanctuary lobby
  • in the Soul Wars Lobby
    • (however, box traps may be smuggled in to the Soul Wars Arena with the Hunter Kit spell).

Creatures[edit | edit source]

The following Hunter creatures may be caught using the box trapping technique.

Creature Exp. Location
27 Ferret 115 Piscatoris Hunter area
53 Chinchompa 198.25 Piscatoris Hunter area, Isle of Souls and Kourend Woodland
63 Carnivorous chinchompa 265 Feldip Hunter area, red chinchompa hunting ground and Gwenith Hunter area
73 Black chinchompa 315 Wilderness

Multiple traps[edit | edit source]

Box trapping can be done with multiple traps at once, with the maximum amount of traps depending on the player's Hunter level.

An extra trap may be set while hunting black chinchompas in the wilderness.

Traps
1 1
20 2
40 3
60 4
80 5

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 September 2021
(update)

Box traps can no longer be placed on top of flowers indoors.

25 October 2018
(update)

Box traps may no longer be placed at Blast Furnace.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • If the player attempts to lay a box trap at Ungael's crater, the chatbox will state "It's far too cold for you to setup a trap here." even though other cold areas such as the Ice Path do allow players to set up traps.
  • Box traps may be laid to temporarily prevent rockfalls from blocking a path at Motherlode Mine, until the box trap collapses and for a short period thenafter. The falling rocks will still damage the player.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 2 November 2016. (Archived from the original on 15 August 2019.) Mod Ash: "+2% for the smoke, +3% for the bait."

[[File:Box trap detail.png|left|110px]]
A '''box trap''' is a type of trap used in the [[Hunter]] skill. The box trapping technique is used to catch [[ferret]]s and [[Chinchompa (disambiguation)|chinchompa]]s. With the required Hunter level and partial completion of the [[Eagles' Peak]] quest, the player may set up a box trap. When a chinchompa or ferret passes the trap, it may be caught, but only when the player is not standing on the trap.

If the prey is successfully caught, the box trap will close in around the animal, and the player will have the option to "check" the trap. If not successful, the trap will also close, and the player will have to reset it.

Adding bait to a trap will increase the catch rate by +3%, while smoking a trap will increase the catch rate by +2%.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/793829284288851968|date=2 November 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190815201833/https:/twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/793829284288851968|archivedate=15 August 2019|quote=+2% for the smoke, +3% for the bait.}} Due to the low increase of the catch rate, most players believe that smoking or adding bait to traps doesn't justify the extra actions it takes.

Box traps may be bought from [[Aleck's Hunter Emporium.]] in [[Yanille]] or the [[Nardah Hunter Shop]] in [[Nardah]]. One can also be obtained for free by searching the crate adjacent to the bookcases in the northernmost house at [[Land's End]]. They can also be obtained from [[hunter kit]].

Like other laid traps, box traps cannot be placed:
*while in duels at the [[Duel Arena]]<!--I don't think your opponent will fall for that.-->
*at the [[Blast Furnace]]<!--The foreman won't be happy if you set up a trap here.--> 
*[[Taverley]], [[Dwarven Mine]] and [[Mining Guild]]<!--The dwarves won't be happy if you set up a trap here.--> 
*[[Wintertodt]] (including the waiting area) and [[Ungael]]'s crater<!--It's far too cold for you to setup a trap here.--> 
*[[Tempoross Cove]]<!--"It's too wet and windy for you to set up a trap here."-->
*[[Hallowed Sepulchre]] and [[The Nightmare]] fight<!--A strange magical force won't let you setup a trap here.--><!--Including the Hallowed Sepulchre lobby and next to its bank chests.-->
*on [[fairy rings]] 
*inside most indoor areas<!--You can't lay a trap here.--><!--Down the ladder at Barbarian Assault, the hallways are mapped "outdoors" while the wave area rooms are "indoors". Most indoor areas really, including Lumbridge Castle indoors, Lumbridge general store, Lumbridge furnace, next to Phials at Rimmington and other Rimmington houses. Gasp.-->
*[[Farming Guild]]
*[[Basement of Doom]] - while spectating your cat through a curtain
*[[Lizardman Temple]]
*[[player-owned house]]s
*inside [[bank]]s and next to various [[bank chest]]s<!--You can't setup a trap here.--> 
**(but next to the bank chest at [[Trouble Brewing]], the [[Ver Sinhaza]] bank booths and the [[Rogues' Den]]<!--The fire is an indoors tile: "There isn't anything to catch indoors!" Under the Wall safes is not possible.--> bank chest is possible)
*[[Hespori]]'s cave <!--It's far too damp for you to setup a trap here.--> 
*[[Zulrah's shrine]]<!--It's far too damp for you to setup a trap here.--> 
*[[Catacombs of Kourend]]<!--An ancient power won't let you setup a trap here.--> 
*in underwater areas<!--It's just a little too damp for you to set up a trap here.--><!--Both Mogre Camp and Fossil Island underwater.--> 
*[[Theatre of Blood]]<!--The vampyres won't be happy if you set up a trap here.--> 
*near [[Shura]] and [[Sisterhood Sanctuary]] lobby<!--Shura won't be happy if you set up a trap here.--><!--Extends few tiles up the stairs too.--> 
*in the [[Soul Wars Lobby]]<!--Nomad won't be happy if you setup a trap here.--> 
**(however, box traps may be smuggled in to the [[Soul Wars Arena]] with the [[Hunter Kit (spell)|Hunter Kit spell]]).

==Trivia==

*Box traps may be laid to temporarily prevent [[rockfall]]s from blocking a path at [[Motherlode Mine]], until the box trap collapses and for a short period thenafter. The falling rocks will still damage the player.
